title: How Many Calories Are in Cum?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in cum from one average ejaculation, plus protein, carbs, fat, and other nutrients in this bodily fluid breakdown.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Cum?
assumptions: Average human male ejaculation (~3.5 ml volume); composition based on typical semen analysis.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies greatly by individual, diet, health, hydration, and volume. Not intended as dietary advice; consult medical professionals.

quick_answer.text: One average ejaculation of cum provides about 20 kcal, primarily from fructose and proteins.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one ejaculation of cum?
faqs.a: Approximately 20 kcal for an average 3.5 ml ejaculation.
Mainly 2.2 g carbs (sugars), 1.5 g protein, 0.2 g fat, and about 140 mg sodium.
Yes, around 1.5 g per average ejaculation, from enzymes and sperm proteins.

faqs.q: How does diet affect calories in cum?
faqs.a: Higher sugar intake can increase fructose content, raising calories slightly.
Yes, only 0.2 g total fat per ejaculation, with minimal saturated fat.
